info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 06 at 5:56PM EDT until April 06 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Prince Edward County in central Virginia... Northern Lunenburg County in south central Virginia... Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Central Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 556 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jetersville to near Crewe to near Green Bay, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Crewe and Jetersville around 600 PM EDT. Kenbridge and Amelia Courthouse around 620 PM EDT. Nottoway, Scotts Fork, Spainville and Chula around 635 PM EDT. Blackstone around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include North Wellville, Irby, Arvins Store, Earls, Murdocks, Rodophil, Nutbush, Scholfield, The Falls and Winterham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
